availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lewis F. Struve (Clermont Co, OH, & Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer and merchant)

body.p: Clermont County, Ohio, and Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer and merchant. Native of Saxony. Son of John H. Struve and Henrietta Struve. Married to Julia A. Carpenter Struve in Clermont County, Ohio, on March 30, 1852. Father of John M. Struve, Lewis D. Struve, and Felix Kirby Struve. Farmer in Clermont County, Ohio, in 1850.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Clermont County, Stonelick, p. XA/B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Richland District, p. 224B.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #1048.
"Lewis F. Struve (1832-1892)," Find A Grave, Memorial #166927590, accessed March 1, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/166927590.
Ohio Marriage Records, 1774-1993, Clermont County Marriages, 1844-1855, Film #000327561, p. 52.
